author: VNExplorer
title: Presidente de Uruguay: No hemos podido bajar el número de homicidios
text: Presidente de Uruguay: No hemos podido bajar el número de homicidios El presidente de Uruguay, Luis Lacalle Pou, dijo que su Gobierno "no ha podido" bajar el número de homicidios del país como lo hizo con las rapiñas, hurtos y abigeatos, pero que tiene "una enorme preocupación" por la escalada de ese delito. Así lo aseguró a la prensa durante una inauguración de obras en el departamento (provincia) de Soriano (oeste) el mandatario, quien fue consultado sobre el caso del cuádruple homicidio ocurrido el pasado jueves en Montevideo, que reavivó el debate sobre el aumento de los asesinatos en el país. "Lo que nunca he hecho y no voy a hacer en los días que me quedan de Gobierno es poner excusas, hay una enorme preocupación por los homicidios", lanzó este miércoles el presidente centroderechista, cuyo mandato terminará en 2025 y del que se conocerá su sucesor tras las Elecciones Nacionales del próximo octubre. "Nunca escucharon a este Gobierno decir son ajustes de cuentas, esto o lo otro, son homicidios, hay vidas que se pierden y en este caso además la de un niño", siguió el presidente, en alusión al caso en que fueron asesinados en el barrio Maracaná dos adultos, un niño de 11 años y una adolescente de 16 años. A lo que insistió en que no quiere "justificar", aseveró que el récord de homicidios en el país se dio en 2018 -bajo el último Gobierno del izquierdista Tabaré Vázquez- "y después (el número) se mantiene estable desde hace mucho tiempo". "Lamentablemente esto se mantiene hace 10 años", enfatizó Lacalle Pou, quien apuntó que no comparte "que se utilice esto como una plataforma de campaña" de cara a las primarias del 30 de junio, en las que los partidos elegirán sus candidatos únicos a la Presidencia. "No podemos con los homicidios" Según el presidente, por otro lado, el Observatorio Nacional de Violencia y Criminalidad, que, puntualizó, "es el mismo de hace muchos años y no es que este Gobierno lo haya puesto", informó que en su mandato se dio un descenso de otros delitos como las rapiñas, los hurtos y los abigeatos por "primera vez en muchísimos años". "¿Estoy conforme? no, no estoy conforme, pero hay que decir la verdad, los delitos han bajado, no podemos con los homicidios", redondeó, e indicó que sobre el cuádruple homicidio las autoridades "tienen elementos importantes para poder resolver el crimen", cuyo móvil es un "conflicto" entre grupos prolongado por 'mucho tiempo'". El ministro del Interior, Nicolás Martinelli, aseguró el martes en una conferencia que Uruguay tiene "un problema con los homicidios" y que la cartera está ocupada en ello. "Hemos implementado un cambio en el departamento de Homicidios (de la Policía Nacional) que ha logrado mejorar sustancialmente el nivel de esclarecimiento", apuntó.

author: Francesco Falcone
title: Inquinamento da Pfas in Val Susa: analisi, dati e misure comune per comune - La Stampa
text:
All’indomani dell’incontro del 10 dicembre tra sindaci, rappresentanti delle Unioni montane, vertici di Smat, Ato, Asl To3 e Arpa sul tema dell’inquinamento da particelle Pfas di alcune fonti di acqua potabile della Val di Susa, e della presa di posizione degli enti locali che hanno annunciato di «non voler abbassare la guardia sul fenomeno, che merita anche approfondimenti di natura tecnico-scientifica», in queste ore è il Comitato Acqua Sicura a tornare sulla delicata questione che da oltre un anno crea apprensione tra i cittadini della Val Susa.
Inquinamento in 23 Comuni «Fin dal 2023, almeno 23 Comuni della Valle sono interessati dal problema: le analisi degli ultimi mesi indicano un inquinamento diffuso, e in alcuni casi pericolosamente vicino ai futuri limiti di legge» spiega il Comitato popolare che nel fine settimana ha diffuso in un incontro pubblico a Mompantero i dati forniti ai Comuni proprio da Arpa e Smat al tavolo istituito da Unioni montane e sindaci. Dati emersi in seguito a una serie di un centinaio di campionamenti in Valle a un anno dai primi test positivi risalenti al 2023.
Cosa sono i Pfas - Clicca per approfondire I PFAS (sostanze perfluoroalchiliche) sono un gruppo di composti chimici usati per rendere materiali resistenti all'acqua, al grasso e alle macchie. Si trovano in prodotti come pentole antiaderenti, abbigliamento impermeabile e imballaggi alimentari. Sono chiamati "sostanze chimiche eterne" perché si degradano molto lentamente, accumulandosi nell'ambiente e negli organismi viventi. Alcuni PFAS possono essere dannosi per la salute, associati a problemi come alterazioni ormonali e rischi per il fegato, motivo per cui la loro presenza viene monitorata e limitata in molti Paesi.
Il pericolo smaltimento illegale Sull’origine del fenomeno che coinvolge in modo non uniforme, a macchia di leopardo, l’intera vallata alpina di confine al momento circolano solo ipotesi: «Smaltimento illegale di rifiuti o utilizzo di Pfas in alcuni cantieri sono i primi indiziati» punta il dito il Comitato. Le amministrazioni locali sono, invece, più caute nell’indicare possibili cause. Va, peraltro, ricordato che ancora di recente la Smat ha rassicurato sulla tenuità del fenomeno, ribadendo che l’acqua erogata in Val Susa alla popolazione, e nel resto del territorio Torinese, «è sicura e con valori entro i limiti di legge».
I dati In effetti, scorrendo la lista dei Comuni in cui i campionamenti hanno mostrato tracce di queste sostanze, impiegate tra l’altro in alcuni refrigeranti, lubrificanti e in varie lavorazioni industriali dalla cosmetica alla produzione di elettrodomestici, in Valle non si registrano sforamenti del limite previsto dalla normativa (massimo 100 nanogrammi per litro) che è prossima ad entrare in vigore. Sono comunque presenti alcuni valori abbastanza elevati. Soprattutto in qualche sorgente dei Comuni di Caselette (fino a 90 nanogrammi per litro), Chiomonte (82), Gravere (86), Villar Dora (60), Bardonecchia (37) e Caprie (32). Mentre è priva di inquinamento da Pfas l’acqua della diga di Rochemolles (Bardonecchia), che fornisce ormai da diverso tempo gran parte dell’acqua che sgorga dai rubinetti delle abitazioni dei valsusini.

author: 网易
title: 高考结束妈妈没接到儿子，进入宿舍竟被震撼，网友：人生第一桶金|男孩|苦读_网易订阅
text:
2025年夏季高考结束了，对于寒窗苦读12年的学子来说，也是交了一份满意的答卷。接下来，又开始了一个假期，这可能是上学期间最长的一个假期了。他们放松几天后，会开始对自己假期的打算，有的甚至还会去干暑假工挣钱，这是好事，但是他们没有想到，他们的计划还没有开始，有人在结束高考当天就赚到了第一桶金。
6月9日，浙江一位妈妈跟很多家长一样，准时出现在学校门口，去接考完试的孩子。
当时学校门口人来人往，家属扛着行李，孩子背着包，都步履轻松地往车上放。
这位妈妈目送了很多车辆离去，仍然没有看到自己的儿子。现场的车越来越少，妈妈等的有点焦急，但还是稳住了心态，一分一秒等着。
然而自己儿子的身影仍然没有出现，这时候她开始担心了。
究竟怎回事呢？这位妈妈就往儿子宿舍走去。一路揣着疑问，妈妈终于找到了儿子宿舍，当她进去后，完全傻眼了。
儿子当时正在忙碌地收拾着东西，脸也热的红红的，汗珠滴下来。这位妈妈再仔细看，儿子行为完全出乎预料，自己也被感动了：她的儿子正在往一个大大的袋子里，装各种书跟本子。
原来，高考结束后，学生们就开始收拾东西，准备回家，毕竟此时，是完全放飞的时刻，结束了12年的学业，他们那里还顾及很多，觉得一些书没用了，也就没有必要带回家，于是这些书只能孤零零地留下。
教室里，宿舍里，到处都是不用的书跟课本，男孩就跟俩同学一起，都收集起来，现场堆了好几座小山，男孩再把小山装进提前备好的大大的袋子里，当时天气也热，孩子浑身衣服湿透了，据孩子妈妈说，当时知道他买了3个大袋子，不曾想是这个用途。
开始因为没接到孩子担心，突然看到这一幕，妈妈瞬间也被震撼到了，虽然当时心里有一丝丝难受，但还是被孩子的行为打动了，小小年纪就知道收拾这些东西卖钱，真是难能可贵。
男孩考试结束后又约了两个同学，一起收拾。就这样，3个男孩忙碌了好长时间收拾完，又送到废品站，然后再分钱，一直到晚上9点多才回家。
虽然是小事，但是感触颇深。看到这个，有网友就说，怎么当初自家孩子就没有想到呢，有的学生打算暑期干临时工赚钱，还没有行动，这3个孩子在放假当天就赚到了，这是高考后第一收入。
事情在网络传播，网友知道后，都是纷纷夸赞。
都说浙江人聪明，头脑灵活，还真不假，连一个18岁的学生都能做到这样，要不说，论做生意还属浙江呢！
不管钱多少，男孩的做法让人点赞，可以说，这是他人生的第一桶金，这是他付出勇气赚来的钱。
有网友说自家孩子高一，天天车接车送，晚餐还要姥姥跟奶奶轮着做饭给他，即使这样还挑食，说饭菜不好，看到男孩能收拾高考完的书卖钱，很是感动，夸赞懂事。
不过这一点得到男孩妈妈的认同，男孩妈妈说孩子从小就很懂事，3岁时候，自己下班回到家，男孩正在看电视，怕影响到妈妈休息，在没有大人的安排下，自己将电视调到静音，只看屏幕里的人。
现在很多孩子都学会攀比，随时伸手跟大人要钱，甚至觉得父母付出的理所当然，这个男孩的行为值得很多孩子学习，尤其那些衣来伸手，饭来张口的娇生惯养的孩子。希望男孩的事能被更多孩子看到，然后受到启发，也去做一些力所能及的事情，锻炼自己坚强的意志。
声明：个人原创，仅供参考

author: GittyAiden
title: CM Maryam Inaugurates Honhaar Scholarship Program for 30,000 Students
text:
Punjab Launches Honhaar Scholarship Program, Empowering 30,000 Students Punjab Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz Sharif launched the Honhaar Scholarship Program on Wednesday to ensure access to quality education for deserving students across the province.
The program aims to support deserving students pursuing higher education by providing comprehensive scholarships covering 100% of tuition fees. A total of 30,000 students will benefit from this initiative each year, with provisions made for public university students and graduates in 16 major fields.
A significant portion—32%—of the scholarships is allocated to students from South Punjab, highlighting the government’s commitment to equitable opportunities for students across the province.
Speaking at the launch ceremony held at Punjab University, where she disbursed checks to successful applicants, Chief Minister Maryan Nawaz emphasized the transformative power of education.
“Education is the cornerstone for individual growth and the advancement of our society as a whole,” she stated.
At least 18,000 female students are among the recipients of these scholarships, exemplifying the program’s dedication to empowering young women in their pursuit of higher education. Applications poured in from students at 65 universities, 359 colleges, and 12 medical colleges across Punjab, reflecting the wide reach of the program.
The Punjab Higher Education Department hailed the Honhaar Scholarship Program as a groundbreaking initiative designed to empower students and support their academic progress.
### Achieving Eligibility for the Future
Applicants must meet specific eligibility criteria to qualify for this generous scholarship program.
* They must hold a domicile from any district within Punjab and be under 22 years old. A maximum annual family income of Rs 300,000 is required to ensure the program benefits those most in need.
* Focalized towards academic excellence, the program prioritizes students promising bright futures. Applicants must be enrolled in designated disciplines in universities or colleges during the fall 2024 semester.
* The program aims to support the next generation of medical professionals with newly enrolled MBBS and BDS students who apply for the program.
* Minimum academic requirements are in place: a minimum of 80% marks in Medical Colleges and 80% marks for top universities, with 75% for Science and 70% for Arts and Social Sciences in Public Sector universities and 65% marks for Science and 60% for Arts and Social Sciences in HED colleges. Every detail can be found at https://honhaarscholarship.punjabhec.gov.pk/#/
The Honhaar Scholarship Program’s creation demonstrates a firm dedication from Punjab’s leadership to invest in the future of its citizens by dismantling financial barriers and 菌promote inclusive access to quality education.
The government encourages all eligible Punjab students to apply for this opportunity through the dedicated online portal.

author: Rachel Metea
title: Community solar bill passes Montana Senate - pv magazine USA
text:
A bill establishing a legal framework for community solar projects passed the Montana Senate.
SB 188, Revising solar energy policy laws would allow a solar developer to build a solar array between 50 kW and 5 MW, and sell shares of the electricity generated to subscribers, which would be used as credits on their electricity bill.
The bill’s sponsor, Sen. Chris Pope, who unsuccessfully introduced similar legislation in 2023, said the bill would expand access to locally generated, emissions-free power, which would decrease participants’ utility bills, support a growing but underdeveloped industry and improve the grid’s resilience to extreme weather events.
The bill passed through the Senate with 38 votes. More than 20 people testified in favor of SB 188 and two representatives from Montana’s investor-owned utilities testified against the bill.
Scott Sweeney, a former general manager of Fergus Electric Coop testified on behalf of Northern Plains Resource Council. “Montana families and local businesses pay for the electricity that has increased substantially over the last few years. Perhaps even more troubling, these rate hikes don’t have an end in sight,” he said.
Sweeney pointed out that things people can do to lower their electric bills are sometimes hard to do.
“Not every house is suitable for rooftop solar,” he said. “There’s barriers that renters can have and it can be hard to do these upgrades. Senate Bill 188 enables a voluntary program that these Montanans could use to cut through all the barriers and access impactful and helpful savings.”
“Fortunately for us in here in Montana, we know that this type of program works because it’s common across the country with 24 states having similar programs,” Sweeney said.
Sweeney pointed out that nine electric cooperatives in Montana currently offer community solar subscription offers, which he said “see high demand for subscriptions and deliver benefits to their members.”
During his tenure at Fergus Electric, Sweeney said the coop had “a very good experience” with community solar. “It showed me that this opportunity can and should be made available to investor-owned utilities,” he said.
Sweeney described the setup as having been “very doable” for his staff and its management “seamless” and mostly automated for both the staff and members.
“This interest stemmed from the fact that these projects were performing the way they were intended to effectively in delivering cost savings to our members,” he said.
During his testimony, Sweeney noted that both Montana-Dakota Utilities Company and NorthWestern Energy recently raised their rates by 9% and 28%, respectively, and are currently working on another round of proposed rate increases. Community solar can offset these rates, he said.
“I’m a captive to NorthWestern Energy,” another Montana resident, Jack Hanson, testified. Born and raised in Montana, Hanson is a homeowner and a “reluctant customer of NorthWestern Energy,” he said. “I say reluctant because I have no choice about where to buy my electricity. There is no market for me to shop among suppliers.”
“Like many of my neighbors, I’m falling behind,” Hanson said, noting that his electric bill has increased 28% over the last two years, while in contrast, his income has only increased 4% over the same period.
“The bill extends some measure of choice to captive utility customers like me,” he said. “It promises to reduce my monthly electric bill, by allowing me to buy solar energy credits,” he said. “It costs us taxpayers nothing at all, and it will encourage our investor-owned monopolies utilities to be more responsive to its customers.”
Alan Olson, NorthWestern Energy’s director of government affairs, said the utility is not in “the least little bit” opposed to renewable energy. Olson said “community solar loads [NorthWestern Energy] down with doing all of the paperwork. That is a cost that’s passed on to other ratepayers.”
Olson said NorthWestern wants interest and demand to go through the qualifying facility process, referencing a Montana Public Service Commission-regulated process that allows smaller power generators to tie into transmission infrastructure owned by a monopoly utility.
Pope responded to these concerns, saying pains have been taking to ensure there are no cost shifts associated with the bill.
Blake Bjorson, a commercial solar developer for OnSite Energy, said that along with creating opportunities for people like himself that can’t otherwise participate in community solar, SB 188 will lower electricity.
“Folks investing in these [programs] are buying into the long-term energy savings,” he said. “Knowing these systems will last 30+ years, so they’re buying into that long term nature. They’re also hedging against future utility price hikes,” he added.
“Shared solar is more cost effective than individual rooftop systems because it benefits from economies of scale,” Bjorson said. “We can build larger systems and have them be less expensive on a per kilowatt basis than multiple small ones.”
Bjorson’s testimony said SB 188 is also important because it will help grid reliability. “I’m a huge fan of distributed energy,” he said. “It reduces stress on the grid, especially during peak demand periods like hot summer afternoons when air conditioners are running and solar panels are producing at their peak.”
“With ever increasing electricity demand, we need to welcome the development of new energy generation sources,” Bjorson said, “and shared solar should be part of that.”
